item.description: Hi Anita my friend & I make your caramlised balsamic vinegar all the time once tried we wont use anything else so DELISH. PS hubby so luvs it also.

item.title: By: LSmith
item.dc:creator: LSmith
item.description: Just prepared double batch and is now resting overnight. Just the speed of whisking....I was up to 8, down to 2 on my kitchenaid for ten minutes! Seems to have done the trick, just hope it was at ok speeds?!??!! Ha looking forward to tomorrow, seeing how it turns out now! Thanks
item.content:encoded:
Just prepared double batch and is now resting overnight. Just the speed of whisking….I was up to 8, down to 2 on my kitchenaid for ten minutes! Seems to have done the trick, just hope it was at ok speeds?!??!! Ha
looking forward to tomorrow, seeing how it turns out now! Thanks

item.title: By: Anita
item.dc:creator: Anita
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/caramelised-balsamic-vinegar/comment-page-1/#comment-5584">Peta</a>.
Hi Peta I tend to leave it in the cupboard. I'm not sure how long it would last (if for some reason it was not eaten), although I would expect it to last a year or more. Thanks Anita
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Peta.

Hi Peta
I tend to leave it in the cupboard. I’m not sure how long it would last (if for some reason it was not eaten), although I would expect it to last a year or more.
Thanks
Anita

item.title: By: Peta
item.dc:creator: Peta
item.description: Dumb question, but do you store the vinegar in the fridge or the cupboard after you have caramelised it?
item.content:encoded: Dumb question, but do you store the vinegar in the fridge or the cupboard after you have caramelised it?

item.title: By: Gib

item.description: Made this today. Worked out great. I didn't put quite as much sugar as I didn't want it too sweet.
item.content:encoded: Made this today. Worked out great. I didn’t put quite as much sugar as I didn’t want it too sweet.

item.title: By: Meg
item.dc:creator: Meg
item.description: Easy and tastes better than the expensive one. Added some to a cream sauce and had a fancy addition to roast chicken breasts. Thanks for a great blog and recipes.
item.content:encoded: Easy and tastes better than the expensive one. Added some to a cream sauce and had a fancy addition to roast chicken breasts. Thanks for a great blog and recipes.

item.title: By: Riley
item.dc:creator: Riley
item.description: Had bruschetta at a restaurant recently and the caramelised balsamic dribbled over made it absolutely amazing. Will be serving a similar treat for Christmas. Can this dressing be made a few days in advance and stored(if so whats the best storage) or is it a "straight from the pan to table recipe"?
item.content:encoded: Had bruschetta at a restaurant recently and the caramelised balsamic dribbled over made it absolutely amazing. Will be serving a similar treat for Christmas. Can this dressing be made a few days in advance and stored(if so whats the best storage) or is it a “straight from the pan to table recipe”?
